zone.line: But it belongs to a philosophical critic
to distinguish rather than confound.
The second part of these remarks
it's application of these
will have for their object in consideration
principles the
of the present state of the cultivation
of Poetry in England, & a defence of
the app attempt to idealise the
modern forms of manners & opinion,
and compel into them into a subordination
-dination to the imaginative & creative
faculty. For the literature of England,
an energetic developement of which
preceded or accompanied
has ever followed a great & free
developement of the national will,
has arisen as it were from a new birth.
In spite of the low thoughted envy
which would undervalue contemporary
will be
merit, our own is a memorable age
in intellectual atchievements, & we
live among such philosophers & poets
